arm_group.description: The FLEX System will be used to endovascularly create a fistula in CKD patients who require hemodialysis vascular access

brief_summary.textblock:
The primary objective of this clinical study is to evaluate the preliminary safety and
      effectiveness of using the FLEX-1 device for the creation of an arteriovenous fistula (AVF)
      including coiling of the brachial vein during the index procedure in patients requiring
      chronic hemodialysis.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Prospective Clinical Evaluation of the Total Vascular Access (TVA) FLEX-1 Device Protocol Flex-1-002-IR Intervention Reduction (IR)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Eligible for a native surgical arteriovenous fistula, as determined by the treating
             physician.

          -  Adult (age >18 years old).

          -  Advanced chronic kidney disease (CKD), stage 4 or 5 electing for hemodialysis.

          -  Written informed consent obtained

intervention.description: The FLEX System will be used to endovascularly create a fistula in CKD patients who require hemodialysis vascular access

clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Clinical Evaluation of the TVA FLEX-1 Device Protocol Flex-1-002-IR Intervention Reduction

oversight_info.authority: Paraguay: Ministry of Public Health and Social Wellbeing

primary_outcome.description: The safety of the FLEX-1 system based on the overall complication rates derived from adverse event data.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: The functionality of the AVF will be measured based on use of the AVF with two needles for at least 75% of dialysis sessions over a 4-week period following at least a one month maturation period.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
